job_title: Learning Technology Rover, Faculty of Science
job_description: Job Summary - Learning Technology Rover, Faculty of ScienceThe primary duty of this position is to provide initial or Tier 1 face-to-face support for faculty members where they work.  The role includes basic support and troubleshooting in the use of learning technologies, as well as appropriate referrals to other services such as Faculty-based teaching and learning support offices, CTLT, and/or UBC IT.Work Performed● Provides basic or Tier 1 educational technology support to faculty members in their offices by gathering information, analyzing the systems, determining the problem and providing a resolution if possible● Troubleshoots technical issues as they arise; ensures that issues are reproduced, documented, and appropriately referred as needed● Supports faculty members in the use of Connect; assists faculty members in uploading and organizing course material within Connect; checks that course content appears in the correct place in the LMS; checks links● Supports and trains faculty members in the use of iClicker, Collaborate, iPeer, Turnitin, Calibrated Peer Review, WeBWorK, Blogs, Wikis and other tools as appropriate● Supports and trains faculty members with DIY video and screencasting tools including recording technologies and editing software such as Camtasia, iMovie, and Movie Maker● Refers faculty members, as appropriate, to faculty-based teaching and learning support units, to CTLT, and/or to the IT Service Centre for services they need● Maintains an accurate record of issues faced by faculty members● Participates in ongoing training, and is encouraged to be part of campus-wide sharing and disseminating of best practices, exemplars, and resources● Performs other duties as assigned
job_requirements: Education/Work Experience (or equivalent combination of education and experience)● Experience as a student at UBC● Experience in customer service, preferably Helpdesk support● Experience and knowledge of technology and an interest in its use for teaching and learningSkills● Familiarity with discipline-specific use of learning technologies● Basic understanding of HTML● An ability to display initiative and creativity with high productivity● An ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously● An ability to work efficiently and independently● Excellent communication and customer service skills● Responsible, professional, reliableReportingThis position reports to the Instructional Technologies Analyst, Faculty of ScienceOpen To All Majors:No
